comments:
driver: 441_0828 candidate
to reproduce:
1. launch Eclipse with fresh workspace. 
2. profile an external Java application with IAC. (Application to be attached in this bug)
3. Profile monitor view shows resources created, but application is never launched and no data is collected.

Created an attachment (id=77148)
zip of application
Problem is reproduced with both IBM and SUN JVM 1.5.
Application is launched if RAC is started, however there is still no data collected and cannot be terminated (bug 201447)

I'm seeing this as well. When an application is launched from the workbench no data is collected, the agent entry is frozen in "<monitoring>", and the console window does not contain the console input from the agent. I am unable to terminate the application from the workbench.

Likewise, if I start an application with JVMTI in controlled mode from the command line, and then 'Attach to Agent' in Eclipse, the program never runs; it just keeps waiting at the command line for a connection from the client.

I observe this behaviour with every application that I try to profile, w/ and w/o AC security.

I see the following exception during the external application launch, above:
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.exceptions.TimeoutException: Launching Process command timed out.
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.AgentController.queryAgentByProcessID(AgentController.java:512)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.AgentController.getAgent(AgentController.java:866)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.jvmti.client.internal.launcher.TIDelegateHelper.locateTIAgent(TIDelegateHelper.java:781)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.jvmti.client.internal.launcher.TIDelegateHelper$2.processLaunched(TIDelegateHelper.java:459)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.ProcessImpl.launchAC(ProcessImpl.java:599)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.ProcessImpl.launch(ProcessImpl.java:133)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.jvmti.client.internal.launcher.TIDelegateHelper.launchProcess(TIDelegateHelper.java:492)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.jvmti.client.internal.launcher.TIDelegateHelper.launch(TIDelegateHelper.java:313)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.jvmti.client.internal.launcher.TIJavaLauncherDelegate.launch(TIJavaLauncherDelegate.java:37)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.internal.launcher.core.LauncherUtility.delegateInit(LauncherUtility.java:1163)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.provisional.launcher.PrimaryLaunchDelegate.run(PrimaryLaunchDelegate.java:196)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:801)


And finally, I've found that I'm able to profile just fine when I use the 4402 eclipse client, with the 441 AC.

Testing using 4.4.1-200708280100, Windows XP w/ firewall off, and was able to reproduce on three separate Windows machines.
